item.title: Temporary traffic lights signal, 5th November
item.description:

item.title: Street Works and temporary lights causing huge traffic, 5th November
item.description:
Street works signs and closures put in place with no one being seen working when I passed by at 3 pm on 05/11/25. It's just causing traffic backlog in Park Street as the red light stays on for a long time and this road is very busy road used by the road users. Another road work across the road in Portman Street narrowing the lane with a temporary traffic light. Temporary lights must be managed and being timed based on the traffic flow. There is no traffic light at the junction with Portman Street/ Oxford Street as it has been covered due to road work. Apart from traffic build up, safety issues must be addressed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 116, Park Street, Mayfair, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Black bags left on pavement, 5th November
item.description:
This is the 2nd time in 2 months that someone has left blag bags like this

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Approach, Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lights coming on ate and not bright, 5th November
item.description:
Street lights in Francis Road are only coming on at 6pm. A mother carrying a baby tripped over in the dark. Please can these be reset and made brighter when on. Many thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38, Francis Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Excessive amount of leaves, 5th November
item.description:
The leaves are not being cleared regularly on a road lined with large trees the leaves fall daily and worst when it is windy or raining.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Victoria Park Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Large rubbish items dumped beside the litter bin on Webber Row, 5th November
item.description:
The litter bin is located at the junction of Webber Row and Webber Street. There are large items of rubbish lying on the pavement next to the bin. There have been several instances of rubbish being dumped by this litter bin recently.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Webber Street, Southwark, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: All gaps between my paving outside, 5th November
item.description:
Right outside my house i have a small pavement area and all the pavements are separated and its having all weeds and grass growing through I’m sick of taking it all up constantly. The pavements are also becoming loose as the gaps widen.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Queensbridge Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
